result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keion D Butler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keion D Butler in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Keion D Butler.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Keion D Butler.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties informed the Court of the defendant's recent arrest.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keion D Butler in court with Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski on behalf of Attorney Kirk Emick.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Keion D Butler in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.

ADDRESS INFO for Keion D Butler
Current: 2556 N 17th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2022)
Prior: 3349 North 11th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 029386,
Payable Number: 995331,
Receipt Number: 22RP012289,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Keion D Butler in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on an active scene. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Keion D Butler in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Keion D Butler in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
